meanings.definition: To cause to feel sick or disgusted
meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten eggs can nauseate some people.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster ride made her nauseate.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs might nauseate some, but others find it adventurous.
meanings.sent4: The sight of blood can nauseate even the bravest of souls.
meanings.sent5: The putrid odor from the garbage bin nauseated everyone in the room.

meanings.sent1: The spoiled milk made her nauseate immediately.
meanings.sent2: The thought of failing the test made him nauseate.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie was so intense that it made her nauseate with fear.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal by her best friend made her heart nauseate with sadness.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine made him nauseate, but he knew it would help him get better.
